content.text:
# Houldsworth Working Men's Club

|architect = Abraham Henthorn Stott
|client = William Houldsworth
|completion_date = 1874
|structural_system = Red brick with stone dressings
| designations        =
}}
}}
'''Houldsworth Working Men's Club''' is a club in Reddish, an area of Stockport, Greater Manchester, England (). Designed by Abraham Henthorn Stott for the local mill-owner William Houldsworth and completed in 1874, it is still used as a working men's club today. An important local structure, it was designated a Grade II* listed building in 1973.
See also
* Houldsworth Mill, Reddish, also designed by Stott
